person_credits.name: Colin Upton
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, cover, production

description: Agents Gibson and Hatch catch up with Chester and Ike, the men who purchased the contents of unit 44, but the items have disappeared once again. Just what was inside the locker and why is Senior Agent Ballard so desperate to get it back? In the midst of the chaos a new threat reveals itself.
name: 2 of 4

description: The duo of Alexandro Jodorowsky and Moebius lead us on a sensual and poetic journey, creating before us an erotic masterpiece.. PUBLICATION IN 1 VOLUME - COMPLETED SERIES. In Angel Claws, frequent collaborators Alexandro Jodorowsky and Moebius (The Incal, The Eyes of the Cat) indulge their naughtier sides as they describe a young woman's quest for sexual awakening. Suggestive eroticism quickly evolves to metaphysical delirium.

‚ÄúReturn to Gaia‚Äù part 1 of 2! Diana‚Äôs visit to Paradise Island‚Äôs harvest festival is interrupted by monsters! Typhon, the last son of Gaia, is breaking free of imprisonment and his minions have already begun wreaking havoc.
name: Return to Gaia Part 1 of 2

description:
Alastair Sterling was the inventor who sparked the robot revolution, and because of his sudden death he didn't see any of it.

That is, until he unexpectedly wakes up in a robot body that matches his old one exactly and finds out that 16 years have passed. Until he steps outside and finds a world utterly unlike the one he left behin - a world where robots live alongside their human neighbors and coexist in their cities. A world he helped create.

Now Al must track down his old partner Brendan to find out who is responsible for Al's unexpected resurrection, but their reunion raises even more questions.

Like who the robot living with Brendan is.

And why she looks like Al.

And how much of the past should stay in the past.

Adult themed comic.
name: Volume One

description: Coal must complete a quest for Odin in order to reach Valhalla, but unfortunately he needs Loki's help to do it.
name: Volume One

description:
1. Flash Gordon

2. Blondie

3. Laugh Time

4. Tarzan

5. Blondie

6. The Nebbs

7. The Katzenjammer Kids

8. Jungle Jim

9. Little Iodine

10. This Funny World

11. Red Ryder

12. Blondie

13. Don Winslow

14. Tiger Tosser

15. The Phantom

16. Cuties

17. Best Laughs of '45
name: Flash Gordon

description:
76-Page Arachnid Action!

Edge Of Spider-Verse continues! It's 1939 and only one man can clean up New York: the Spider-Man!

Plus, Spider-Man's biggest fan is about to become his deadliest enemy!

Also, discover the origin of the turbo-charged supervillain known as Overdrive (and just why he stole that school bus)!

By Dan Slott, Ram√≥n P√©rez, David Hine, Fabrice Sapolsky, Richard Isanove, Nick Spencer, Steve Lieber!

Includes material reprinted from Amazing Spider-Man #1.3, Edge of Spider-Verse #1, Superior Foes of Spider-Man #13!

76-Page Action-Packed Arachnid-Pages!

Edge of Spider-Verse continues! Superior Spider-Man leads the Spider-Men against the mysterious predator!

Also, Clash is out of control and only Spider-Man can stop him!

Plus, Are Shocker and Silverman taking over?!!

Meanwhile, the Sinister Six had better look out, as Owl and Chameleon want revenge!

By Dan Slott, Christos Gage, Giuseppe Camuncoli, Ram√≥n P√©rez, Nick Spencer, Steve Lieber!

Includes material reprinted from Amazing Spider-Man #1.4, Superior Spider-Man #33, Superior Foes of Spider-Man #15!

When German forces invaded the Netherlands in 1940, Dutch Army Lieutenants Dirk Dreise and Ruud Aaker fought in the front line. The campaign went against them, though, forcing them to escape to England where they were assigned to clandestine intelligence work.

Eventually the tide of war turned and in 1944 they were back in their homeland, determined to throw the invaders out. For them, the fighting raged not in the air or on land but on the waters of the flooded polders.
name: The Deadly Waters

description:
Joe Brady was as tough as the Liverpool slums that had bred him - and, boy, he could hate!

The many Nazis he met knew the cold ferocity which blazed in his eyes as he swept into battle, but they could tell no one.

For dead men tell no tales.

Introduction

Some of you may wonder how we choose which titles to let you read again. Well, there are loads of different reasons but, it the case of this story, one trumps all others. It was drawn by Victor De La Fuente and, as far as I'm concerned, any excuse to let you see his magnificent art is good enough. I grew up reading Commando stories and his illustrations never let me down, combining accuracy, aggression and activity in every frame.

Victor's style influenced many other artists, and at least one reader, to get involved in comics. Thanks, Victor.

Calum Laird, Commando Editor

Note: Originally published as Commando No 149 (January 1965), re-issued as No 743 (May 1973).
name: Tough Guy

description:
Canadian sniper Michel Caron had been recruited by Gabe Dubois, his adopted brother, for a special mission that required expert, high-precision shooting.

In the bombed-out ruins of Caen in Northern France, death lurked in every shadow - and the brothers soon realised that both of them would have to be ready to sacrifice anything, even their own lives, to complete their deadly task...
name: Brothers In Danger

description:
All it took was one shot from a flare pistol to bring the entire German armoured column to a chaotic standstill.

There was no shock wave, no heat blast‚Ä¶just a silent explosion of brilliant light that blinded every pair of eyes within a mile. Even inside tanks there was no protection from this unearthly glare, this terrible...

SECRET OF THE ALPS

Introduction

Saichan - responsible for the inside art here - drew 13 Commandos in total. Well, not quite, his final book (Unlucky 13) had to be finished by another artist. The reasons are lost in the mists of time but it wasn't due to lack of quality for his style - though quirky, and cartoon-ish in places - is certainly effective.

The story is classic Alan Hebden, a man well known for intricate plotting and (just) believable secret weapons. He was on his game for this one!

Saichan's Unlucky 13, by the way, featured some of Commando's early recurring characters - The Bomb Gang. This story is as explosive as any of theirs.

Calum Laird, Editor

Note: Originally published as Commando No 2343 (January 1990), re-issued as No 3947 (October 2006).
name: Secret of the Alps

description:
The Official Guide to the 2013 Series

Discover the behind-the-scenes secrets of the Eleventh Doctor‚Äôs adventures, in the latest DWM Special Edition. The Official Guide to the 2013 Series is researched and compiled by Andrew Pixley, and packed with previously unpublished photos, day-to-day details of Doctor Who‚Äôs production and hundreds of fascinating new facts. Containing amazing in-depth articles on the TV episodes The Snowmen, The Bells of Saint John, The Rings of Akhaten, Cold War, Hide, Journey to the Centre of the TARDIS, The Crimson Horror, Nightmare in Silver and The Name of the Doctor, this is the essential guide to Matt Smith‚Äôs final season as the Doctor.
name: The Official Guide To the 2013 Series

description:
DOCTOR WHO MAGAZINE SPECIAL #38: THE YEAR OF THE DOCTOR

Discover the behind-the-scenes secrets of the most exciting year in Doctor Who's long history in the latest DWM Special Edition! Doctor Who celebrated its 50th anniversary in 2013, marking half a century of time-travel adventures. The Year of the Doctor is researched and compiled by Andrew Pixley, and has 100 pages packed with previously unpublished photos, day-to-day details of Doctor Who‚Äôs production and hundreds of fascinating new facts.

This essential guide contains in-depth articles on the Paul McGann mini-episode The Night of the Doctor; the 50th Anniversary Special The Day of the Doctor; Matt Smith's final story The Time of Doctor; the drama based on the origins of the series, An Adventure in Space and Time; the hilarious The Five(ish) Doctors Reboot; Doctor Who at the Proms 2013; the Brian Cox lecture The Science of Doctor Who; the documentaries Doctor Who: The Ultimate Guide and Me, You and Doctor Who; Doctor Who Live: The Afterparty; and much, much more!
name: The Yearbook of the Doctor: The Official Guide To Doctor Who's 50th Anniversary

description:
Doctor Who Magazine Special: The Art of Doctor Who

The characters and scenarios from Doctor Who have been inspiring artists since 1963. The latest special edition of Doctor Who Magazine celebrates the best of their contributions to both the programme and the vast range of licensed products that rely on their skill.

‚ÄúThis is how the story of Doctor Who unfolded in the eyes of the artists who interpreted, shaped and represented the show,‚Äù says editor Marcus Hearn. ‚ÄúIn fact, the story begins before the first episode was even transmitted ‚Äì we have articles examining the creation of the Doctor Who logo and the filming of the original title sequence.‚Äù

This 100-page Special is packed full of stunning reproductions of original artwork from the Dalek annuals, the Doctor Who annuals, Doctor Who Weekly, the DVD range, the Radio Times, Target Books, TV Century 21, the VHS releases and more.

Other highlights include:

  • Articles covering the history of graphic design and illustration in Doctor Who, from the early 1960s to the present day.
  • Award-winning graphic designer Bernard Lodge explains how he created the series‚Äô first four title sequences.
  • Concept artists Peter McKinstry and Matt Savage share their portfolios from 21st-century Doctor Who.
  • Interviews with Target Books artists Chris Achilleos, Jeff Cummins, Bill Donohoe, Roy Knipe, Tony Manero, Andrew Skilleter and Nick Spender.
  • Interviews with comics artists including Mike Collins, Martin Geraghty, Dave Gibbons, Richard Piers Rayner, John Ridgway, Nick Roche, John Ross, Adrian Salmon, Lee Sullivan and Alice Zhang.
  • Interviews with VHS and DVD cover artists Lee Binding, Colin Howard and Alister Pearson.
name: The Art of Doctor Who

description:
After Achea attempts the ritual for the orchard of life, Princess Achea and her companions begin their journey to Rumburum. Along the way, they run into some friendly merchants. Since both caravans are headed towards Rumburum, Achea decides that they will travel together. Not long after this decision is made trouble strikes our heroine. When the opponents seem to have won the fight a white feathered fighter intervenes.

Chapter Titles

  • Di-No 21: Vapell Viji, The Orchard of Life ~Dark Shade of the Green Tree~
  • Di-No 22: Vapell Viji, The Orchard of Life ~The Wind Sickle Scatters Flowers~
  • Di-No 23: Vapell Viji, The Orchard of Life ~The Tree Top's Last leaf~
  • Di-No 24: Pajil Kotakku, The Mark In the Desert Canal ~Mutual Attraction~
  • Di-No 25: Pajil Kotakku, The Mark In the Desert Canal ~Childhood Friend~
  • Di-No 26: Pajil Kotakku, The Mark In the Desert Canal ~The Eroding Sun~
name: Vol. 5

description:
Fuajarl and Rumburum have long been rivals as the two dominant symbols of The Elbas continent. Needless to say, when Achea, the Princess of Fuajarl, arrives in Rumburum to ask their king for support, she's met with a little friction. However, all that is instantly forgotten as Filo, human Edel Raids, attack Rumburum's royal family. As the moon is swallowed by the darkness, Achea is left with one final decision to make and it becomes such a heavy burden.

Chapter Titles

  • Di-No 27: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~MOONLIGHT~
  • Di-No 28: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~ROYAL FAMILY OF THE MOON~
  • Di-No 29: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~THE SUN AND THE MOON NEVER RESONATE~
  • Di-No 30: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~LUNAR ECLIPSE~
  • Di-No 31: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~GUARDIAN OF THE MOONLIGHT~
  • Di-No 32: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~THE GUIDANCE OF THE DAWN CAGE~
  • Di-No 33: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~THE DOUBTFUL KNELL OF A LONG, DARK ROAD~
  • Di-No 34: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~GRACEFUL DANCE OF THE PROUD SUN GUARDIAN~
  • Di-No 35: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~EROSION~
  • Di-No 36: Rumburum, Shining City in the Moonlight ~THE BRUNT OF HOPE AND DESIRE~
name: Vol. 6
The Creatures From The Black Leather Lagoon

description:
Doctor Who Magazine: The 2015 Yearbook

LOOK BACK ON AN AMAZING YEAR FOR DOCTOR WHO, WITH THE 2015 YEARBOOK!

The latest Special Edition of Doctor Who Magazine reviews an incredible year for the programme, its spin-offs and licensed merchandise. Highlights include our first major interview with the show‚Äôs executive producer, Brian Minchin, in which he reflects on Peter Capaldi‚Äôs first year as the Doctor and looks forward to further adventures with the Twelfth Doctor.

ALSO INSIDE THIS 100-PAGE ISSUE...

  • Features on every episode in Peter Capaldi‚Äôs first series.
  • We speak to the team that accompanied Capaldi and Jenna Coleman on the Doctor Who World Tour.
  • Fourth Doctor Tom Baker discusses his return to television and audio Doctor Who.
  • Eighth Doctor Paul McGann reveals what he thinks about Capaldi‚Äôs Doctor.
  • Orchestrator and conductor Ben Foster previews the 2015 Symphonic Spectacular.
  • Inside the new ‚Äòmaking of‚Äô show, Doctor Who Extra.
  • Behind the scenes at the new Doctor Who Experience in Cardiff.
  • Interviews with some of the key players behind recent books, soundtracks, audio dramas, DVDs, Blu-rays and action figures.
  • Highlights from the year‚Äôs newspaper and magazine reviews of Doctor Who.
  • A round up of Doctor Who‚Äôs awards and honours from the last 12 months.
  • Detailed tributes to the Doctor Who luminaries who passed away in 2014.
    ...and much more!

‚ÄúThis is the Doctor Who Magazine almanac,‚Äù says editor Marcus Hearn, summing up the new publication. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve taken a fresh look at every episode from Peter Capaldi‚Äôs first series, but we‚Äôve also explored many other corners of the Doctor Who universe. For many fans, the television series is just part of a world that includes DVDs, Blu-rays, books, soundtrack albums, audio dramas and action figures. We‚Äôve tried to reflect the last 12 months in all those different areas.‚Äù
name: The 2015 Yearbook

description:
1001 Nights - Hunchback's Tale

From the famed tales of 1001 Nights, The Hunchback's Tale tells the story of a three people who think they accidentally killed a poor hunchback. The truth is far stranger than they imagined.
name: Hunchback's Tale

description:
Spider-Man's greatest fashion disaster continues! With his symbiotic black costume safely removed and imprisoned for study, Spidey re-dons the classic red-and-blues to battle fearsome foes including Hobgoblin, Silvermane and the Kingpin! And when the Black Cat whips him up a homemade version of his ebony ensemble, Spidey can embrace a modern look that only looks killer. But while Peter thinks he's done with his rather clingy former suit, the sinister symbiote isn't finished with him -- and when it escapes and seeks out its former host, Spidey's going to have to do some quick thinking in order to avoid becoming a permanent part of the alien duds! Guest-starring the Human Torch, Thor and the X-Men!

Collects Marvel Team-Up (1972) #146-150; Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #96-100, Annual #4; Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #259-263; Web of Spider-Man (1985) #1.
name: Book 2

volume.name: The Amazing Spider-Man: The Complete Alien Costume Saga

description:
Silhouettes of Assurance

Chapter 05 of Avaiyo, Vol. 01

After centuries of slavery under the oppressive rule of the Tamiran Empire, the people of Xiltria could no longer bear such anguish. Through immeasurable losses and hardships, these suffering victims were finally able to win back their lands. By forming militias and unifying all slaves together under one flag they were eventually able to crush the Tamiran Empire who had conquered the world so long ago. The people now had a fresh start in life. With their new "free world" they finally have a chance to get what they've wanted from the very start...peace.

Their dreams have been realized. Regions. Countries. Nations have been restored to their former glory. All of Xiltria now works together. With their continued efforts to reshape the world it is a time of prosperity. However, the seeds of evil have endured. In the underbelly of society, subtle remnants of the exiled Tamiran Empire still live on...and are starting to give way towards a new threat.

It's been nearly eight years since the citizens of Xiltria regained their freedom. Sekken, a young man who lived through the carnage, travels the world in an attempt to suppress any threats that could endanger this new "free world."
name: Silhouettes of Assurance

description:
76 pages of Earth's Mightiest Heroes!

Earth has been destroyed, and humanity is dead ‚Äì now only the mutants survive on Planet X! Havok fights for the Avengers as Kang plans his revenge! The shocks keep coming in 'Avenge the Earth'!

By Rick Remender and Daniel Acuna!

Featuring material first printed in Uncanny Avengers #18-21.

The epic conclusion to the Ballad of Rory Hawkins story! Before Rory can settle things with Charlie Manson, he has to protect himself and Franny as they are chased through Los Angeles and into the surrounding mountains where they find themselves at the mercy of DeGuerres, a member of the Straight Satans biker gang.
name: Chapter 7

description: Bruce Wayne and Lucius Fox travel to Germany to meet with the engineer of the new Batmobile. But when Fox is kidnapped for ransom, Batman must dispense his brand of justice during a high-speed chase through the streets of Berlin!
name: Need for Speed Part 1 of 1

description:
Introduced by your host, The Bloke, a Victorian undertaker, who I dress as at conventions to promote the magazine. Bloke's Terrible Tomb of Terror is a homage to the classic horror anthology magazines that we grew up loving.

This is an ongoing, self-published series, with eleven issues currently available and two collected editions. Voted Best Anthology Of 2013 in the Ghastly Awards.

Writers - Jason 'The Bloke' Crawley, Richard Matheson, Scott Tipton & Fabrizzio Fassio

Artwork - Mike Hoffman, Jason Paulos, Jon Christopher Ledford, Rock Baker, Scott Shriver, Alessandro Borroni, Marco Perugini & Rob Moran.
The final issue of the cult favorite series taring Battlestar Galactica and The A-Team's Dirk Benedict. The action adventures continues with "Dirk Benedict in the 25th Century".

In this issue...

IT'S 10 YEARS SINCE DOCTOR WHO RETURNED TO TELEVISION ‚Äì AND DOCTOR WHO MAGAZINE CELEBRATES WITH FOUR VERY SPECIAL COVERS FOR ISSUE 485!

Ten years after the Ninth Doctor (Christopher Eccleston) grabbed the arm of Rose Tyler (Billie Piper) and told her to "Run!", Doctor Who is still going strong, as one of the greatest TV success stories of the past decade. Doctor Who Magazine celebrates this milestone with a special commemorative issue that comes with four different covers, each one featuring one of the twenty-first century Doctors ‚Äì Christopher Eccleston, David Tennant, Matt Smith and Peter Capaldi!

Inside the issue, we look back on the show's success, with contributions from writers Steven Moffat, Mark Gatiss, Robert Shearman, Paul Cornell, Toby Whithouse, Gareth Roberts, Chris Chibnall, Peter Harness and Jamie Mathieson, as well as from BBC Head of Drama Commissioning Ben Stephenson, who gives his view on the future of Doctor Who...

ALSO INSIDE ISSUE 485 OF DWM...

  • Russell T Davies, the writer of the landmark first episode, Rose, and many other episodes since, looks back on his first Doctor Who script, and shares brand new information about bringing the Doctor back to our screens.
  • DWM tracks down a guest star from each and every one of the ten Ninth Doctor adventures, including Camille Coduri (Jackie Tyler), Yasmin Bannerman (Jabe the Tree), Alan David (Gabriel Sneed), Alan Ruscoe (the Slitheen and other creatures), Barnaby Edwards (the Dalek), Bruno Langley (Adam Mitchell), Shaun Dingwall (Pete Tyler), Florence Hoath (Nancy), Annette Badland (Blon Fel-Fotch Passameer Day Slitheen) and Jo Joyner (Lynda 'with a Y' Moss).
  • Doctor Who's first director of the modern era, Keith Boak, is interviewed, looking back on the making of Rose, Aliens of London and World War Three.
  • Doctor Who's first ever director, Waris Hussein, concludes his look back over the epic lost adventure from 1964, Marco Polo.
  • DWM pays tribute to 1980s director Fiona Cumming, who passed away earlier in the year.
  • The Doctor and Clara visit Antarctica in Part One of Blood and Ice, a brand-new comic strip written by Jacqueline Rayner and illustrated by Martin Geraghty.
  • Steven Moffat answer readers‚Äô questions ‚Äì and speculates about Osgood's family connections!
  • Jacqueline Rayner reflects on what life would have been like if Doctor Who had never returned in Relative Dimensions.
  • The DWM Review assesses the very latest Doctor Who audio and book releases.
  • The Watcher reveals the connection between Doctor Who and Dr Carl Sagan, in the latest Wotcha!
  • The DWM Crossword, prize-winning competitions, official news and much more!

List of covers and their creators:

CoverNameCreator(s)Sidebar Location
ACover APhoto1
BCover BPhoto2
CCover CPhoto3
DCover DPhoto4

76 pages of Mutant Mayhem!

Cyclops and Marvel Girl are on the run ‚Äì but are they endangering the entire timestream with their presence? The X-Men of the future say yes!

By Brian Michael Bendis and Stuart Immonen!

Featuring material first printed in All-New X-Men #17, X-Men #6, Uncanny X-Men #13 and Wolverine & The X-Men #37.

Light

Alone. I am now all alone. The war is over, we have won, why do I feel so alone? Those of us who remain, rejoice... yet I am overcome with such great sadness. So much has been lost, destroyed by these years of battle. This world, my home, I barely recognize it.

What have we truly saved?

What are we really celebrating?

WE came here to stop the greatest Evil the 12 worlds has ever known. In doing so, we brought light back out of the darkness yet, now, all I can feel is a rising darkness within myself.

The light is gone.
name: Light

description:
In their first outing, the Ghoul Squad nearly managed to capture a werewolf. However, the werewolf escaped, leading the Ghoul Squad to return to the castle to formulate a new plan.

Little do they realize that the werewolf is following them back to the castle.

In The Shadow of the Beast

With the Forge of Hephaistos in ruins, Argus must free himself from the wreckage in time to warn the gods of Olympus of the attack...every moment being relentlessly pursued by the Hadean beast he fears above all else!
name: In The Shadow of the Beast!

description:
All The King's Horses

The union has some wins at the office, while Gary turns down an unlikely alley for help with his daughter's new condition. Meanwhile a plot begins to hatch amongst the henchmen.

Note: The digital edition (4/22/2015) for this issue was released before the print edition.
name: All The King's Horses

description:
76 pages of gamma-charged mayhem!

The Hulk invades the sinister scientific outpost known as the Beehive! By Mark Waid, Joe Bennett and Jheremy Raapack!

The Wendigo horde attacks Las Vegas! Guest-starring Ms Marvel, Moon Knight and the Sentry! By Jeph Loeb and Arthur Adams!

She-Hulk leads a team of Earth's mightiest superheroines against the Red Hulk! By Jeph Loeb and Frank Cho!

Featuring material first printed in Indestructible Hulk #19-20 and Hulk #9.

Tank battles across the Eastern Front!

Following the events of Book One, Katusha, and her adopted sister Milla join the Red Army and are sent to tank school. Trained to operate the mighty T-34, Katusha fights from countryside to cities, but as in any way there is always a steep price to for victory, and Katusha must deal with her own devastating personal loss.

This is a story of courage, survival and family; of self-sacrifice, betrayal, brutality, and suffering; it is a tale told against the backdrop of the bloodiest conflict in human history: the 1941-1945 war between Nazi Germany and Soviet Russia.

Seen through the eyes of a Ukrainian teenage girl, KATUSHA is not only a coming-of-age story, but a carefully researched depiction of one of the most turbulent and important periods of the twentieth century.
name: Book II: The Shaking of the Earth

volume.name: Katusha Girl Soldier of the Great Patriotic War

description: After reporting to London, Kathy Austin returns to Kenya to continue her investigation. In the palace of Count Di Broglie, the young English woman finally meets the last survivors of the Remington expedition, but they lack material proof to support their stories. Kathy is ordered to obtain information on Irmanius, a rather inquisitive individual who‚Äôs been snooping around the country. Who is he working for? The Americans, the Russians‚Ä¶ or some considerably more foreign power?
name: Aberrations

description:
Be My Clementine

What's more romantic than summer love on the Boardwalk? Brian is just a tough, sweet kid working a new job at the seashore when he falls in love with the main attraction. But there's more to this story than "boy meets girl" in this sweet tale with a tail!

Love makes a splash in "Be My Clementine", story by Ashley Leckwold; art by Jarrod Perez with color by Sara King, letters by Joe Botsch! Inspired "Good Old-Fashioned Lover Boy", this is the thirteenth story in KILLER QUEEN, A COMIC ANTHOLOGY. The digital version features a Queen-inspired BONUS from artist Jason Strutz and a note from the writer!

A tribute to the greatest band in Rock-n-Royalty, KILLER QUEEN features twenty-seven works from over forty artists and writers, challenged to rock out to their favorite Queen track and use it as inspiration for an original short comic or vignette. Edited by Enrica Jang.
name: Be My Clementine

description: Chapter 405 - 415.
name: Volume 38

description:
The King is Dead Part 3 of 4

The digital edition has been painstakingly re-formatted and extended specifically for viewing full screen on tablets. 45 pages of high definition digital art, with a story that sees The Lion and The unicorn of the title take a step closer to their final show down in the city of Thamesis Where the King's funeral is held and a young, would be freedom fighter is lead down a dark path with the promise of revolution.
name: The King is Dead Part 3 of 4

description:
Impact

Having been told of a nearby settlement Lloyd and Bear are travelling to meet up with some of Bears' fellow Burians.

Little do they know it's actually a slave camp and any plans they had of relaxing and playing games of Fubump (which is so much fun although by the end of it I couldn't look at another cake for a week!) is soon to be scuppered!

A new two part story begins this issue! Check it out!
name: Impact

description: While taking part in a rodeo in Wisconsin, Lucky Luke and Jolly Jumper meet Mario Bombardier, a Quebecois cowboy, and his mare the beautiful Province. It‚Äôs love at first sight for the two horses, and after the inevitable separation, Jolly Jumper can‚Äôt stop moping. Eventually Luke decides to head to Quebec in order to arrange a reunion ‚Äì and discovers the merry atmosphere of the Nouvelle France: mounted police, bar fights, poutine, traditional French songs ... and an unscrupulous, wealthy banker...
name: The Beautiful Province

description: The power of the Markings is revealed. But the killer on their tail is still a mystery. The Markings were supposed to be a secret. Who else knows?

76 Action-Packed Pages in the Mighty Marvel Manner!

While Arnim Zola prepares to invade the Earth, Cap must battle his son!

Also: Tony Stark is on trial for the murder of the Phoenix Force!

Plus: Thor and King Thor wage war on Gorr, the God Butcher! But what of young Thor?!

By Rick Remender, John Romita Jr, Kieron Gillen, Greg Land, Jason Aaron and Esad Ribic!

Includes material reprinted from Captain America Vol.7 #8, Iron Man Vol.6 #7 and Thor: God of Thunder #7!

76 pages of Marvel Universe adventure!

Daredevil and Elektra take on the Sons of the Serpent ‚Äì and Foggy Nelson's fate leads Matt Murdock to a decision that will change his life forever! By Mark Waid and Chris Samnee!

Arcade watches as the young heroes finally turn on each other! Who will survive the brutal Murder World? By Dennis Hopeless and Kev Walker!

Featuring material first printed in Daredevil #35-36 and Avengers Arena #16-17.
Princess and Willard spend some time in the slammer.

David Bloch has undergone his ‚Äútreatments‚Äù at Golden Path, but where does that lead him. As David learns more about himself, what are other people‚Äôs intentions for him. What exactly is his role, pawn or king?

Curse of the Dreadnuts

The action continues! Sora stole the experimental Samurcycle... with three Dreadnuts on his tail! The continuation of Curse of the Dreadnuts sees the Violet Samurnaut in the most danger he's ever faced. And with the rest of the team still licking their wounds from the first attack? How will he survive? And what of the Samurnauts of 1851? The Steampunk Samurnauts faced BlackStar and his mysterious Sea Witch... but something happened that Master Al has hidden for centuries. It's time to venture forth, and see the pulse-pounding continuation of your favorite Samurai-Astronauts!

The Samurnauts: Curse of the Dreadnuts #2 is a 37 page full cover adventure suitable for all age enjoyment. Featuring the artwork of Matt Wright, the fine words of Kyle Gnepper, and a story written, and drawn by Marc Alan Fishman.
name: Curse of the Dreadnuts

description:
Contains the following serials:

TIME AGENT Z - SPANISH AMERICAN ZOMBIE WAR

-Teddy Roosevelt versus Zombies!

MUSCLES & MULLETS - THE CASE OF THE PEOPLE PINCHING PRIMATE

-The Nova Brothers Detective Agency is called in to rescue a girl from a dangerous cult.

DOGTOWN - US VS THEM

-The Dogtown Police crack down on illegal technology.
name: Vol. 3

description: An old seaplane skims the waves over the Pacific. Onboard are Vito Cortizone, former Don of the New York Mafia forced into early retirement by Spirou and Fantasio; Von Schnabbel, unscrupulous pilot; and a mysterious cargo supposed to turn Cortizone‚Äôs fortunes around. But the mafioso is cursed with terrible luck, and the plane ends up at the bottom of an isolated island‚Äôs lagoon. When two months later a sailing boat arrives, an unrecognisable Vito sees none other than our two adventurer-reporters come ashore!
name: Tough Luck Vito

description:
The Space Between Words

The eighteenth issue of Strip For Me, the full story The Space Between Words presents a lifetime in a haze of broken memories, in the fragments of a romance, in the small minutes and long hours. We follow Lotte through her life, her marriage and beyond, as she attempts to makes sense of everything around her.
name: The Space Between Words

description: Thorgal, his family and their friends Darek and Lehla have left their island to sail south and look for a safer place to live. After a storm scatters them, Thorgal and WolfCub‚Äôs boat flounders on reefs at the foot of a strange, mist-covered cliff. One perilous climb later, the little girl is trapped by a mysterious, invisible force, and her father, after going for help, discovers a very curious city cut off from the world...
name: Arachnea

description:
The Quest

With the kidnappers gone Zoie laments over her lost friends, until her sister, Bubbles, is found to be alive! Zoie shares the news that Jane has been taken ransom and they have no idea where to start looking. Bubbles finds someone to whom to ask for help but can he be trusted?
name: The Quest

description:
"77 Days in Hell!"

The First Air Cavalry finally manages to arrive to reinforce the exhausted Marines at Khe Sanh. 'Journal' discovers that the number of reporters covering the Vietnam War is growing, perhaps because the media is sensing that it might soon be over.
name: 77 Days in Hell!

volume.name: Vietnam Journal: Bloodbath at Khe Sanh

description:
76 pages of claw-popping action!

The SHIELD Helicarrier is invaded! Wolverine confronts an alien menace ‚Äì and suffers a terrifying loss! By Paul Cornell, Alan Davis and Mirco Pierfederici!

Deadpool enters the funky 1970s and meets Power Man and Iron Fist! By Brian Posehn, Gerry Duggan and Scott Koblish!

Featuring material first printed in Wolverine #4-6 and Deadpool #13.

The Devil Deals a Crooked Hand

The Z is for Zombies and West refers to the Wild West. Z West is a multi-book series about four primary characters in the Texas territory. Due to the barbarism of an army regiment an ancient curse is visited on a small border town.
name: The Devil Deals A Crooked Hand

description:
Earth‚Äôs Mightiest Heroes return in the Avengers Age of Ultron Movie Special.

When Tony Stark tries to jump-start a dormant peacekeeping program, things go awry and Earth‚Äôs Mightiest Heroes are put to the ultimate test as the fate of the planet hangs in the balance. Ultron, a terrifying technological villain, is hell-bent on human extinction and it is up to the Avengers to stop him from enacting his terrible plans.

Along the way they confront two mysterious newcomers, Wanda and Pietro Maximoff, orphaned twins with incredible powers. The Avengers also encounter The Vision, but is he a friend or foe? Uneasy alliances and new encounters pave the way for an epic global adventure as the Avengers assemble to face a threat that‚Äôs darker than anything they have experienced before.

This movie special magazine is packed with incredible interviews with all of the stars. Go behind-the-scenes and check out the amazing sets, props, special effects and costumes. There‚Äôs also a 20-page comic strip, posters, quiz and a concept art gallery.

volume.name: Avengers Age of Ultron Movie Special

description: Marvel celebrates the greatest super-team the world has ever known with a magazine-sized extravaganza! Meet the creative legend who helped start it all, Jack Kirby, as we look back at his first year of Avengers artistry! Relive the history of Earth's Mightiest Heroes with a series of probing character profiles! Explore the Avengers' creative history with "Earth's Mightiest Interview," a roundtable with some of the greatest writers in the team's history, and have your mind blown by a gallery of all-time great Avengers artist John Buscema's finest work! All this and more, including a countdown of the greatest Avengers stories of all time! Earth's Mightiest Magazine is distributed free in April!

76 Action-Packed Arachnid-Pages! ¬£3.50!

Edge of Spider-Verse continues! Introducing Gwen Stacy as... Spider-Woman!

Plus: Spider-Man must battle Clash one final time!

Also, the Sinister Six are taking over as the new crime lords of New York! But they may have a fight on their hands!

By Jason Latour, Robbu Rodriguez, Dan Slott, Ram√≥n P√©rez, Nick Spencer, Steve Lieber!

Includes material reprinted from Edge of Spider-Verse #2, Amazing Spider-Man #1.5, Superior Foes of Spider-Man #16!

76 pages of Earth's Mightiest Heroes!

This is it! The Avengers have one last chance to save Earth, but Kang and his Chronos Corps have another goal, and it could change everything! Don't miss an epic final battle from Rick Remender and Daniel Acuna!

Prodigy and Speed face a terrifying spectre from the Young Avengers' past! By Kieron Gillen and Kate Brown!

Iron Man finds himself saddled with the alien student called Broo! By Jeff Loveness and Paco Diaz!

Featuring material first published in Uncanny Avengers #21-22, Young Avengers #6 and A+X #17.
